key_points: The Ever Given's owner expects to face hundreds or thousands of legal claims after the ship blocked the Suez Canal.
A London court hearing granted a two-month stay on potential claims against the Ever Given.
Shoei Kisen Kaisha Ltd., owner of the Ever Given, and Evergreen Group are the involved parties.
An earlier court order limited some claims against the ship to 84 million pounds ($116 million).
The Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March, disrupting global trade.
The stay in proceedings aims to group similar claims together, reducing legal costs and court time.
A further court hearing is scheduled in two months to assess filed claims.
The ship's owners claim they are not liable for the grounding incident.
There were some damages to the ship, but no injuries, deaths, or pollution were reported from the incident.
The resolution of any claims filed in the U.K. might take years and could involve arbitration.
